title: Move Ad/Owner Settings into Admin Panel and lock behind PIN 7973

requirements.text: Remove the customer-facing “Ad Settings / Owner Settings” entry from the public site footer (including removing the arrow/chevron indicator shown in the uploaded screenshots), so it is not visible anywhere on the non-admin landing page.

quotes: Isko hta ke admin panel me add kar do is setting ko
Are bhai mene arrow lgaya hai usko htao owner setting ko

acceptanceCriteria: On the public/customer page, the footer no longer shows “Ad Settings” (and no arrow/chevron icon related to it).
There is no clickable navigation path to Ad Settings from the customer-facing UI (header, footer, mobile menu).

requirements.text: Add an “Owner Settings” section inside the Admin Dashboard UI and place the existing Ads settings UI there (reuse the existing AdsSettingsPanel component, but only render it inside the admin experience).

quotes: Isko hta ke admin panel me add kar do is setting ko
Are bhai mene arrow lgaya hai usko htao owner setting ko isko lock kar do password ke sath jese admin panel ko login karne ke liye password chaiye hota hai

acceptanceCriteria: When logged into admin, the Admin Dashboard displays an “Owner Settings” area.
“Ad Settings” is accessible from within that “Owner Settings” area and opens the existing AdSense settings dialog/panel.
AdsSettingsPanel is not rendered on the public/customer page.

requirements.text: Password-protect access to “Ad Settings / Owner Settings” using PIN 7973, with a user flow comparable to the existing Admin Login modal: if a user is not currently admin-authorized, they must enter PIN 7973 before they can access the Owner Settings / Ad Settings UI.

quotes: Are bhai mene arrow lgaya hai usko htao owner setting ko isko lock kar do password ke sath jese admin panel ko login karne ke liye password chaiye hota hai

acceptanceCriteria: If a user is not admin-authorized, they cannot access Owner Settings / Ad Settings without a PIN prompt.
Entering PIN 7973 unlocks access; incorrect PIN shows an English error message and keeps Owner Settings locked.
If a user is already admin-authorized, Owner Settings / Ad Settings opens without requiring the PIN again in the same session/state.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui/*.
Keep the Internet Computer backend as a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not introduce third-party authentication providers; only the existing admin PIN mechanism may be used for this request.
nonGoals: Do not add or change backend persistence for ads settings (keep localStorage-based ads owner settings).
Do not change ad rendering logic beyond removing the public entry point and relocating settings access to the admin UI.
Do not redesign the entire admin dashboard; only add the minimal “Owner Settings” section needed.
